meanings.sent1: The sunrise will precede the sunset today.
meanings.sent2: In history class, we learn about events that precede our time.
meanings.sent3: The early bird always precedes the late risers to the breakfast table.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh cookies baking in the oven precedes the joy of eating them.
meanings.sent5: The sound of thunder precedes the arrival of a storm.

meanings.sent1: Hard work will precede success in your career.
meanings.sent2: In the military, experienced officers precede new recruits in authority.
meanings.sent3: The wise old owl always precedes the young squirrel in the forest hierarchy.
meanings.sent4: Knowledge and expertise precede leadership in any field.
meanings.sent5: Respect for others should always precede seeking power.

meanings.sent1: The lead car will precede the rest of the parade.
meanings.sent2: The guide will precede the group on the hiking trail.
meanings.sent3: The eager puppy always precedes its owner on walks.
meanings.sent4: The first note of the song will precede the rest of the melody.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh coffee will always precede the morning rush.
